column1: Dugda (also known as Deonagar) is a census town in Chandrapura (community development block) in Bermo subdivision of Bokaro district  in the state of Jharkhand
column2: India. It is a  small township
column4: situated under the foot of several small hills. Residents of the township are primarily employees of Dugda Coal Washery under Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL).

column1: Dugda is located at 23.7558°N 86.1534°E﻿ / 23.7558; 86.1534. It has an average elevation of 218 metres (715 feet).
As per 2011 Census of India Dugda had a population of 22
column9: 864. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 46%. Dugda has an average literacy rate of 66%
column10: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 77% and
column12: 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column2: the total number of literates in Dugda was 15

column1: It has a small market situated between the town along with general and other stores scattered all over the town
column2: which fulfills the needs of the people. The city also has many good schools. The students of these schools are working all over the country in different reputed companies.

column1: Khadeswari Temple - It is a famous temple for not only the people of Dugda but also for many other from other places. This place is also known as Pahari Mandir as it is situated on the top of the hill.
Milan Kendra - This is the marriage ceremony hall for the people.
Hanuman Mandir - There are three Hanuman Mandirs situated in the town. One in the middle of the market
column2: second just below New B.C.C.L. Colony and the third one is in B.C.C.L Colony.

column1: Shiva Mandir -There are two Shiva Mandir one temple is situated at the rear side of the main market and another one is in the middle of New B.C.C.L. Colony. It is the temple of Lord Shiva as the main deity
column2: along with many other Hindu Gods.
there is also a Gurudwara and a Mosque.

column1: There is a sports playground at the center of the town mainly used by the local residents for different sports and athletic interests
column2: though it is also used for hosting tournaments
column4: organized in Dugda. There are many other smaller fields in the rest part of Dugda.

column5: Sarhul are celebrated across the township with equal fervor and joy by the multicultural population here. On the tenth day of Durga Puja
column7: which signifies victory of good over bad. People not only from the town but also from the neighboring places gather here to witness this grand spectacle.

column1: There is  a general hospital in the township for the care of people. There are many small dispensaries
The town is well connected through roads and rail. The railway halt (as is better known) is a single line (broadguage) connection between Katrasgarh and Chandrapura.

The hill top temple (Khadeswari Temple) is named after a holy sadhu (Baba Khadeswari) and serves as a tourist attraction here. The temple construction started in the early 1970s and thereafter developmental activities continued through earnings and donations from temple visitors
column2: followers of Baba Khadeswari and Dugda Coal Washery's employees.

column1: Baba Khadeswari was a Sadhu from Uttar Pradesh
column2: who had visited this place in the early seventies and had decided to build a temple on the hill top. He never spoke and communicated only through sign language. He stood throughout his life and used to wear wooden paduka.

column1: Today the temple has become a small tourist attraction. Pucca road from the bottom of the hill till the hill top has already been constructed.
